intro: Octolobus spectabilis, commonly known as the showy octolobus, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
